title: Please remove mamba_ssm forcely requirements
body: Am on MacOS, and am using transformer based model didn't really want mamba_ssm? This thing just keeping get me annoying.
author: lucasjinreal

comments.body:
edit the pyproject.toml file.

/* These are technically optional, but mamba-ssm is required to run hybrid models. */
[project.optional-dependencies]
compile = [
    "flash-attn>=2.7.3",
    "mamba-ssm>=2.2.4",
    "causal-conv1d>=1.5.0.post8",
]
No, you can saw the code, it barely import mamba_ssm everywhere.... (Even users only want transformered model?)
mamba_ssm is already optional; you can just install the required dependencies and run it on your mac.

title: Minor argument type fix in sampling.py
body: Fixing falsely typed argument from float to int (inferred from how it is used in modify_logit_for_repetition_penalty)
author: Quasimondo

comments.body: lgtm

title: Hungarian doesnt work.
body: It does use the uploaded voice as a base. But it sounds like a english speaker trying to speak hungarian and fails.
author: Bandita69

comments.body:
i think some languages are foreseen but not yet implemented:

see the readme file:

`Multilingual support: Zonos-v0.1 supports English, Japanese, Chinese, French, and German`

title: Update README.md docker tag
body: fixed docker dev example, docker tags must be lowercase, otherwise the command throws an error
author: MithrilMan

comments.body: nice catch

title: Finetune code
body: Thank you for this release, it performs very well. Please do consider adding finetune code. Most promising new models ultimately never do, and it really is what sets the most widespread and impressive models apart.
author: dustysys

comments.body: Our training setup is too cursed to share at this time.

I support the original statement.
Even if the training setup is cursed, the community will make it better - for models that are worth it, people invest their time in to make them and the tools for them better..
Zyphra is thus far best TTS I've tried, so there is huge potential for making it #1, if people are given tools to finetune it.
Sure, why not

title: Playground not processing requests
body: Error: Unable to process your request. Please try again.
author: gitmeisteradh

comments.body:
The API seems to be more reliable but regularly fails about ~15% of the time (looks like Cloudflare timeouts).

Recommend playing with the Python API.
If this refers to the web API, we have been hit with heavy traffic and are trying to restore stability to the service. We are sorry that many requests are being dropped right now.
Understood. It seems to be working better today already. Congrats on release.

title: The output of tts is all male voices. Is there any female voice output
body: The output of tts is all male voices. Is there any female voice output, how to obtain female voice
author: dengfenglai321

comments.body: Hey, you can change the voice by providing a short audio clip of your desired speaker. In the gradio interface that would be the box in the upper-right corner.
I made it so the seed changes by default now, so if a speaker isn't provided it will use a random one.

title: chinese language code
body:
Thank you for your open-source project. I am currently doing some testing and saw the definition of supported_language_codes in conditioning.py, 

supported_language_codes = [
    'af', 'am', 'an', 'ar', 'as', 'az', 'ba', 'bg', 'bn', 'bpy', 'bs', 'ca', 'cmn',
    'cs', 'cy', 'da', 'de', 'el', 'en-029', 'en-gb', 'en-gb-scotland', 'en-gb-x-gbclan',
    'en-gb-x-gbcwmd', 'en-gb-x-rp', 'en-us', 'eo', 'es', 'es-419', 'et', 'eu', 'fa',
    'fa-latn', 'fi', 'fr-be', 'fr-ch', 'fr-fr', 'ga', 'gd', 'gn', 'grc', 'gu', 'hak',
    'hi', 'hr', 'ht', 'hu', 'hy', 'hyw', 'ia', 'id', 'is', 'it', 'ja', 'jbo', 'ka',
    'kk', 'kl', 'kn', 'ko', 'kok', 'ku', 'ky', 'la', 'lfn', 'lt', 'lv', 'mi', 'mk',
    'ml', 'mr', 'ms', 'mt', 'my', 'nb', 'nci', 'ne', 'nl', 'om', 'or', 'pa', 'pap',
    'pl', 'pt', 'pt-br', 'py', 'quc', 'ro', 'ru', 'ru-lv', 'sd', 'shn', 'si', 'sk',
    'sl', 'sq', 'sr', 'sv', 'sw', 'ta', 'te', 'tn', 'tr', 'tt', 'ur', 'uz', 'vi',
    'vi-vn-x-central', 'vi-vn-x-south', 'yue'
]

but I’m not sure which one represents Chinese. I tried cs, but it seems incorrect. Could you please help me confirm this? Thank you.
author: softicelee2

comments.body: Yeah this part was ported over in a hurry so it can be confusing. I believe the code for Chinese is `cmn`.
cmn for mandarin, yue for cantonese
thanks for your quick reply，and i works when i choose cmn，thanks again。

title: System (gpu) requirements?
body:
The quality is absolutely amazing!

What are the system requirements, in particular how much GPU vram is required?
author: tleyden

comments.body: Thanks! We haven't thoroughly tested this, but currently I believe any 3000-series or newer NVIDIA card with at least 6GB of VRAM should work.

title: How do I prevent Zonos from adding reverb to the generated audio
body:
Hi!

This project is fascinating! 
Thanks alot for sharing that gem.

No, how can I prevent Zonos from adding reverb to the generated audio.

Thanks :)
author: ubidev

comments.body:
Try to use a cleaner speaker reference clip.
Or use the hybrid model, enable speaker denoising, and if that's not enough, set a high VQScore.

Great hints.
Thanks !
We also have an internal model that can directly remove reverb from the speaker embedding before it's fed into the model. Will try to release that if we find the time.

title: ONNX model
body: Any chance the model can be exported to ONNX?
author: amblamps

comments.body: We intend to release a separate repository with a pure PyTorch implementation in the coming days. Should hopefully be straightforward to export it then.

> We intend to release a separate repository with a pure PyTorch implementation in the coming days. Should hopefully be straightforward to export it then.

excited for this

title: A list of languages supported by Zonos  and Finetunig possibility
body: I want to know the languages supported by zonos and if it's possible to finetune them in another language like haitian creole ?
author: coco-droid

comments.body: +1 about the finetuning support. Would be amazing for other languages

Hey, we will provide a better overview of supported languages shortly.

There are currently no plans to add finetuning support for this release, but we hope to support it in the next one.
For the time being we will not be releasing training code.

I really hope you'll reconsider.
Either way, great job on the model!
